instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD found
threads.message:
I received from a customer a MacBook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 512gb SSD that doesn't detect SSD, neither in disk utility. I found an other topic here with same issue. The logic board hasn't any liquid damage and any visual  defect under microscope, board looks perfect. Is SSD or Controller dead? Has anyone experienced the same issue and can share the solution?

Thanks you in advance

threads.title: Macbook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD found
threads.message:
The solution is a new logic board.

However before this check if the NANDs are getting power @1.8V. Voltage reading on <CAPACITOR>C8801</CAPACITOR> & <CAPACITOR>C8805</CAPACITOR>.

Check  pull-ups on <CHIP>U8821</CHIP> & traces voltage on <CHIP>U8800</CHIP>.

threads.title: Macbook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD found
threads.message: Hopeless cases. Bitch and moan at Apple to replace the board, it should not fail in <2 years.

threads.title: Macbook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD found
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R8803</RESISTOR> is 10k, while <RESISTOR>R8802</RESISTOR> should be 10k but it's about 9k, already replaced it and still same issue. Tolerance is 5%. could be a <CHIP>U8800</CHIP> fault? if I heat that area <RESISTOR>R8802</RESISTOR> goes up to 7k

threads.title: Macbook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD found
Macbook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD found
threads.message: is there anyone who had same issue? I have read many cases of "no ssd" with macbook 12" but I haven't found a solution, probably all of them have same manufacturing issue.

threads.title: Macbook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD found
threads.message: There is no solution to a corrupted NAND. If you are in the EU bitch at Apple and they will fix it if <2 years after purchase.

threads.title: Macbook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD found
threads.message:
I have the same issue.

Can we simply replace the NANDs?

threads.title: Macbook 12 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no SSD found
threads.message: I am not 100% sure, go and find out, but it is all undefilled garbage so it is a nightmare. The NANDs may contain firmware so swapping them for a new one may not work.
